author: Pilar Araque Conde
title: El √©xito de la ‚Äòley de nietos‚Äô del Gobierno espa√±ol: casi 90.000 descendientes de exiliados consiguieron la nacionalidad espa√±ola y la mayor√≠a son argentinos - Infobae
text:
Varios pasaportes espa√±oles colocados sobre una mesa. (Ricardo Rubio - Europa Press) La avalancha de peticiones para ejercer el derecho de optar a la nacionalidad espa√±ola motiv√≥ la ampliaci√≥n de un a√±o del plazo concedido por el Gobierno para optar para esta prerrogativa, contemplada en la ley de Memoria Democr√°tica . El Gobierno prorrog√≥ por un tercer a√±o el plazo de dos a√±os previsto en ese apartado, que se conoce como ley de nietos . En menos de dos a√±os, ya se ha concedido la nacionalidad espa√±ola a 89.766 descendientes de latinos exiliados , especialmente de Argentina y Cuba.
Desde la entrada en vigor de la mencionada Ley, hasta el 31 de marzo de 2024, las Oficinas del Registro Civil Consular han recibido 301.121 solicitudes de opci√≥n a la nacionalidad espa√±ola de origen. As√≠, seg√∫n las cifras aportadas por el Gobierno espa√±ol a Infobae Espa√±a , de estas se han aprobado 150.002 y se han denegado 1.521 . En total, de las aprobadas, ‚Äúse han inscrito ya unas 89.766‚Ä≥, aseguran fuentes del Ministerio de Memoria Democr√°tica.
La ley memorialista, en vigor desde octubre de 2022, reconoce el derecho de optar a la nacionalidad espa√±ola a ‚Äúa los nacidos fuera de Espa√±a de padre o madre, abuelo o abuela, que originariamente hubieran sido espa√±oles, y que, como consecuencia de haber sufrido exilio por razones pol√≠ticas, ideol√≥gicas o de creencia o de orientaci√≥n e identidad sexual , hubieran perdido o renunciado a la nacionalidad espa√±ola‚Äù.
Este derecho es extensivo a los hijos nacidos en el exterior de mujeres espa√±olas que perdieron su nacionalidad por casarse con extranjeros antes de la entrada en vigor de la Constituci√≥n de 1978; y ‚Äúa los hijos mayores de edad de aquellos espa√±oles a quienes les fue reconocida su nacionalidad de origen en virtud del derecho de opci√≥n de acuerdo con lo dispuesto en la presente ley o en la disposici√≥n adicional s√©ptima de la Ley 52/2007, por la que se reconocen y ampl√≠an derechos y se establecen medidas en favor de quienes padecieron persecuci√≥n o violencia durante la guerra civil y la dictadura ‚Äù.
La ley contempla solo la pr√≥rroga de un a√±o ‚ÄòLey de nietos‚Äô en Espa√±a: qu√© requisitos y documentos hay que tener para conseguir la nacionalidad siendo extranjero. La propia disposici√≥n adicional octava de la ley de Memoria Democr√°tica establece que el mencionado plazo de dos a√±os se inicia con la entrada en vigor de la ley, por lo que su vigencia terminaba el 22 de octubre de 2024 . No obstante, este precepto tambi√©n contemplaba la posibilidad de acordar su pr√≥rroga por un a√±o para todos los supuestos a trav√©s del Consejo de Ministros.
En menos de dos a√±os de vigencia, m√°s de un 95% de las solicitudes se han recibido en las Oficinas Consulares de Espa√±a en Iberoam√©rica y en el Consulado General de Espa√±a en Miami . Concretamente, seg√∫n el Ejecutivo, los cinco consulados generales de Espa√±a en Argentina representan un 40% de las solicitudes, y, junto con el Consulado General de Espa√±a en La Habana, superan el 53% de las solicitudes.
‚ÄúEn todas ellas existe un n√∫mero de solicitantes que dif√≠cilmente podr√°n ser citados y atendidos antes de la finalizaci√≥n del plazo de dos a√±os previsto en la citada disposici√≥n adicional octava de la Ley‚Äù, sostiene el Gobierno de Pedro S√°nchez para motivar la decisi√≥n de prorrogar un a√±o el plazo de dos previstos para optar a la nacionalidad espa√±ola.
De esta manera, el Ejecutivo espera que se puedan atender ‚Äútodas‚Äù las solicitudes de cita ya presentadas y pendientes de asignaci√≥n de fecha, as√≠ como todas las solicitudes que se presenten y que no puedan ser atendidas en los dos primeros a√±os de aplicaci√≥n inicialmente previstos en la ley, seg√∫n fuentes del departamento memorialista.
El ministro de Pol√≠tica Territorial y Memoria Democr√°tica, √Ångel V√≠ctor Torres , encargado de anunciar la ampliaci√≥n en la rueda de prensa posterior al Consejo de Ministros del pasado martes, se√±al√≥ que la pr√≥rroga es una ‚Äúmagn√≠fica noticia‚Äù que ‚Äúser√° aplaudida por los espa√±oles que vuelven a asumir que son de nuevo espa√±oles con todos los par√°metros legales establecidos‚Äù.

author: Keenan Cummings ‚Ä¢
title: West Virginia knocks off No. 3 Kansas 91-85
text:
West Virginia did just enough to pull off the upset over No. 3 Kansas 91-85 inside the Coliseum Saturday evening.
The win is the first for the Mountaineers against the Jayhawks in the last six tries and moves their overall record to 7-11 and 2-3 in the Big 12 on the season.
The Mountaineers were led in scoring by guard RaeQuan Battle with 23 points, forward Patrick Suemnick with 20 and point guard Kerr Kriisa with 15.
The Mountaineers kicked off the scoring with a pair of free throws by Battle and the action had a good pace to start with Kansas holding a 13-6 edge at the 15:57 mark. The Jayhawks first four baskets were three-pointers with Johnny Furphy hitting three.
However, the Mountaineers also started hot from deep hitting four of their first five to tie the game at 15-all with both teams shooting over 60-percent.
The Jayhawks lead would sit at 22-18 with 11:49 left from the field as the Mountaineers had all of their field goals from deep. And just a few trips down the floor later, West Virginia would surge ahead 25-24.
After Battle connected on another three-ball to put the Mountaineers ahead 33-31 it forced Kansas to use a timeout with 6:53 left in the first half.
The two teams continued to exchange blows as Battle's 17 points had the Mountaineers within striking distance at 47-43 with 1:52 left in the half. The two teams would take a 51-all tie into the half with Suemnick adding 11 for the Mountaineers.
West Virginia would hold a 55-53 lead at the 16:21 mark as the two teams did not open the second half as crisp as the first.
The two teams then continued to see-saw the lead between themselves over the next several minutes as West Virginia held a 62-61 edge with 13:25 left. As the clock ticked under 9 minutes, the Mountaineers led 72-68 after another Battle three created off an effort offensive rebound by Suemnick forcing the Jayhawks to use a timeout.
West Virginia pushed the lead out to 77-70 their largest of the game, but Kansas continued to battle and cut it to 78-75 with 5:05 left.
With just 3:24 left, a pair of turnovers led to back-to-back baskets by the Jayhawks and forced West Virginia to take a timeout leading just 80-79.
The Mountaineers held an 82-81 lead with 38 seconds left and had the basketball. After a free throw by Quinn Slazinski, the shooter was able to get his own miss and get back to the line to stretch the lead to 85-81 with 33 seconds left.
After a pair of Jayhawks free throws, Kriisa would connect on a pair to put the lead at 87-83 with 20 ticks left. But a Kevin McCullar long two would keep Kansas well within striking distance to make it 87-85 with 11 seconds left on the clock.
Farrakhan would connect on a pair to push the lead to 89-85 and a steal by Kriisa on the in-bounds would add two more to get to the final score 91-85.
While center Jesse Edwards was dressed and warmed up, he did not play in the game.
West Virginia will next travel to UCF for a 7 p.m. tip-off Tuesday night.

title: #44 Un atentado islamista durante la misa de Navidad deja m√°s de 160 cristianos asesinados en Nigeria

1* las atrocidades de grupos islamistas radicales, no como tantos aqu√≠ que aprendieron que eran los talibanes hace 2 meses y ahora los llaman partisanos. Asesinos es su nombre, como es el del gobierno de ir√°n o Arabia Saudita ente otros.
2* cr√≠tico a los que claramente ocultan y defienden a estos asesinos bajo un pretexto de victimismo en Palestina.

author: @BigGo_global
title: Syncthing 2.0 Drops Support for Multiple Platforms Due to SQLite Migration
text:
Syncthing, the popular open-source file synchronization tool, has released version 2.0 with significant changes that have sparked community discussions. While the update brings improvements like a new SQLite database backend and enhanced logging, it also removes support for several platforms, raising concerns among users about the project's direction.
Platform Support Reduction Raises Questions
The most controversial change in Syncthing 2.0 is the removal of prebuilt binaries for multiple platforms, including DragonFly BSD, Solaris, NetBSD, and notably Windows ARM32. This decision stems from complications with cross-compiling SQLite, the new database backend that replaces LevelDB.
Community members have expressed surprise at dropping Windows ARM32 support, especially given the industry's shift toward ARM processors. However, the development team clarifies that Windows ARM64 remains supported, and 32-bit ARM support is being phased out by Microsoft itself in future Windows 11 releases.
The choice of SQLite implementation has also drawn scrutiny. Users questioned why the team selected the CGO-based github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3 over the pure Go modernc.org/sqlite, which would avoid cross-compilation issues. Performance appears to be the deciding factor, as the CGO version offers better speed despite the compilation complexities.
Platforms No Longer Receiving Prebuilt Binaries
- DragonFly BSD (amd64)
- Illumos/Solaris (amd64)
- Linux (ppc64)
- NetBSD (all architectures)
- OpenBSD (386 and ARM)
- Windows (ARM 32-bit)
Note: Windows ARM64 support continues
Database Migration and Performance Improvements
The switch from LevelDB to SQLite represents a fundamental change in how Syncthing stores data. Users report that the migration process can be lengthy for larger setups, but the new database promises easier maintenance and fewer bugs. The update also introduces automatic cleanup of deleted files after six months, addressing long-standing storage concerns.
Multiple performance enhancements accompany the database change. The removal of rolling hash detection for shifted data, while eliminating a feature, actually improves scanning and syncing efficiency. The system now uses multiple connections by default between version 2 devices, with three connections handling different types of data exchange.
Key Technical Changes in Version 2.0
- Database Backend: LevelDB ‚Üí SQLite
- Default Connections: Single ‚Üí Three connections (1 for metadata, 2 for data)
- Deleted File Retention: Forever ‚Üí 6 months (configurable)
- Rolling Hash Detection: Removed for better performance
- Logging System: Restructured with per-package log levels
- Cryptographic Keys: Switched to Ed25519 for sync connections
Android Ecosystem Remains Active
Despite official Android support ending previously due to Google's platform restrictions, the Android ecosystem continues thriving through community forks. The Syncthing-Android fork maintains active development and is available through both F-Droid and the Google Play Store, ensuring mobile users aren't left behind.
Compatibility and Migration Considerations
Version 2.0 maintains protocol compatibility with version 1.x, allowing gradual migration across different devices. This backward compatibility provides users flexibility in upgrading their Syncthing installations without requiring simultaneous updates across all devices.
The community's response reflects both appreciation for Syncthing's continued development and concern about reduced platform support. Many users praise the software's reliability and privacy-focused approach, with some reporting years of trouble-free operation across multiple devices.
Syncthing 2.0 represents a significant evolution that prioritizes performance and maintainability over broad platform support. While some users may need to compile from source or seek alternatives, the core functionality improvements suggest a more robust foundation for future development.
Reference: v2.0.0

author: RotoWire Staff
title: Grizzlies' Ja Morant: Heads to locker room Thursday - CBSSports.com
text:
Share Share Video Link copied! Morant exited Thursday's game against the Warriors due to back soreness and is questionable to return.
Morant was going to shoot the free throws, but instead, he exited the game and went straight to the locker room after a successful challenge. Further details should be given in the near future.

author: The Weather Authority
title: Drier sunny weather returns Tuesday in Central Virginia
text: RICHMOND, Va. -- Tuesday will be bright and sunny, with afternoon highs in the mid to upper 40s. NW winds at 20 mph will make it feel a little cooler through the day. Tuesday night will be cold with lows in the 20s. Wednesday will be bring sunshine mixing with some clouds and highs in the low 50s. There may be a few showers early Thursday with highs in the 40s. Friday will have sunshine. A storm will impact the region next weekend, moving in on Saturday and exiting by noon Sunday. Although it may start as some wintry precipitation, as of now, it looks like the majority of precipitation will be rain for central and eastern VA. Wintry weather will be more likely in northwestern VA. The storm is still a few days away, so we will continue to update the forecast. A shift in storm track by just 50 miles will mean either more rain or more chances for snow. Stay With CBS 6, The Weather Authority. STORM TRACKING LINKS: [Weather Alerts](https://www.wtvr.com/weather/alerts) [Closings & Delays](https://www.wtvr.com/weather/school-closings-delays) [Interactive Radar](https://www.wtvr.com/weather/radar) [Map Center](https://www.wtvr.com/weather/weather-maps) üì± Download the new and improved CBS 6 Weather App for [iPhone](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/cbs-6-richmond-va-weather/id1494043847)and [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.wtvr.android.weather&hl=en_US&gl=US).

author: @infobae
title: Ojeleye y Musa, Jugadores de la Jornada 2 tras las disputa del aplazado Breogan-Tenerife - Infobae
text:
Madrid, 7 nov (EFE).- Semi Ojeleye, del Valencia Basket, y Dzanan Musa, del Real Madrid, comparten la designaci√≥n de Mejor Jugador de la segunda jornada de la Liga Endesa, que se complet√≥ este jueves con la disputa del partido aplazado en su d√≠a entre el R√≠o Breog√°n y La Laguna Tenerif, que se sald√≥ con un ajustado triunfo canario (78-79).
Ambos jugadores sumaron un total de 28 cr√©ditos de valoraci√≥n y contribuyeron a los triunfos de sus respectivos equipos. En el caso del alero del Valencia Basket, es la primera vez que recibe este reconocimiento, mientras que para el jugador del Real Madrid es la octava designaci√≥n, tras las cinco que conquist√≥ en su primera temporada en Espa√±a, cuando defendi√≥ la camiseta del R√≠o Breog√°n y dos m√°s ya con el conjunto blanco.
Frente al Joventut, Semi Ojeleye complet√≥ una de sus mejores actuaciones en la Liga Endesa al anotar 24 puntos en los casi 26 minutos que estuvo en la pista. Convirti√≥ 8 de 12 en canastas de dos puntos (67%), 1 de 3 desde la l√≠nea de tres (33%) y 5 de 5 en tiros libres (100%).
Adem√°s, reparti√≥ dos asistencias que sirvieron para generar cinco puntos m√°s para su equipo, captur√≥ cinco rebotes, recuper√≥ un bal√≥n y forz√≥ cuatro faltas personales.
Por su parte, el bosnio Dzanan Musa sobresali√≥ en el triunfo blanco frente al Casademont Zaragoza, ya que en los poco m√°s de diecinueve minutos que jug√≥ anot√≥ 18 puntos, con 4 de 5 de dos (80%), 1 de 3 en triples (33%) y 7 de 8 en tiros libres (88%), repartiendo adem√°s 3 asistencias, todas ellas en el tercer cuarto, que se tradujeron en 7 puntos m√°s para su equipo.
Adem√°s, sum√≥ 7 rebotes, 1 recuperaci√≥n y 6 faltas recibidas. EFE

author: Olivia
title: Climate Justice Alliance Slams Sen. Barrasso‚Äôs ‚ÄúEnhanced Energy Recovery Act‚Äù as a Sham, Says Carbon Capture Will Boost Dirty Energy Production
text: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: Thursday, September 26, 2024 CONTACT: Brett Abrams | [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#3654445342427643585453585257545a535b53525f571855595b) WASHINGTON, DC ‚Äî Yesterday, U.S. Senator John Barrasso (R-WY) introduced ‚Äì the Enhanced Energy Recovery Act ‚Äì [legislation](https://www.barrasso.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/ee7b5f4b-1da8-4ba8-bcf2-4defd307269b/enhanced-energy-recovery-act.pdf) to enhance carbon capture incentives and energy production. Reacting to the bill‚Äôs introduction, K.D. Chavez, interim deputy director of the Climate Justice Alliance, issued the following statement: ‚ÄúAt a moment when we are running out of time to course correct our energy policy, pushing for more handouts to fossil fuel companies through additional tax incentives will not bring the world any closer to stopping extreme weather and increasingly devastating climate disasters. ‚ÄúInstead of ensuring that oil production is incentivized, which will only further prolong our reliance on dirty industries, Congress should be advancing legislation like Representative Ro Khanna‚Äôs [End Polluter Welfare for Enhanced Oil Recovery Act](https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/9838?s=1&r=1) that eliminates subsidies for companies, mainly big oil companies, that capture carbon and use it to extract more oil and gas ‚Äì a process called enhanced oil recovery. Our communities shouldn‚Äôt be subsidizing wealthy oil and gas companies with our tax dollars; creating even more dangerous climate pollution. Instead, based in free, prior, and informed consent (FPIC), we should safely and effectively advance a clean and green transition away from fossil fuels and toward effective projects that are proven to work, such as community-owned solar and wind. ‚ÄúThe Inspector General of the U.S. Treasury Department found in a 2020 investigation requested by Sen. Menendez that fossil fuel companies improperly claimed almost $ 1 billion under the 45Q tax credit. Far from fixing the problem, Congress expanded the tax credit. Perversely, this proposed bill expands the tax credit even more. ‚ÄúThe irony is not lost on us that this Act was released at a time when many frontline and environmental justice communities are gathered in New York for Frontline Climate Week, where they are organizing for real climate solutions that can be replicated and carried out in communities writ large. We need incentives that promote climate justice, not perverse ones that exacerbate inequality.‚Äù # # # # # #
